intro: Delphyodon oliganthus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lanceolate leaves that are hairy on both surfaces. Its flowers, which are usually blue or violet, bloom in late summer and are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Delphyodon oliganthus prefers well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
